No Poverty.reason: The course focuses on EU political systems and international relations, with no direct link to poverty alleviation.

Zero Hunger.reason: No content addresses food security or hunger issues.

Good Health and Well-being.reason: Health topics are not covered in this course.

Quality Education.reason: The course provides advanced knowledge on EU governance and international relations, enhancing students' academic understanding and analytical skills.

Gender Equality.reason: No explicit discussion on gender issues is included in the syllabus.

Clean Water and Sanitation.reason: Environmental infrastructure topics are not included.

Affordable and Clean Energy.reason: Energy policy and clean energy are not discussed in this course.

Decent Work and Economic Growth.reason: The course touches on EU economic security strategy and trade relations, which may indirectly relate to economic growth.

Industry, Innovation and Infrastructure.reason: The course does not cover technological or industrial development topics.

Reduced Inequalities.reason: Course discusses governance and external relations, which may indirectly affect global inequalities, but not explicitly.

Sustainable Cities and Communities.reason: Urban development or sustainability of communities is not covered.

Responsible Consumption and Production.reason: No focus on production or consumption patterns.

Climate Action.reason: Climate and environmental policies are not explicitly addressed.

Life on Land.reason: Terrestrial environmental topics are not included.

Peace, Justice and Strong Institutions.reason: The course focuses on EU governance, multi-level governance, and foreign policy, contributing to understanding institutional frameworks and peace-building mechanisms.

Partnerships for the Goals.reason: EU external relations with other regions and countries are studied, which aligns with international cooperation aspects of SDG 17.
